abstract_summ: There are now several reports on neurologic features of SARS‐CoV‐2 infection.(1 2) In a recent study of 214 patients with COVID‐19, 78 (36.4%) patients had neurological manifestations, including headache, dizziness, acute cerebrovascular diseases, and impaired consciousness.(2)The outbreak of the novel coronavirus that began in late December 2019 was announced as a pandemic by the World Health Organization as the number of cases is increasing exponentially throughout the globe.At the end of 2019, a cluster of pneumonia patients were confirmed to be infected with a novel coronavirus, known as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.We report the case of an infant who tested positive for severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS‐CoV‐2) and developed mild cardiovascular inflammation, a novelty for patients of very young age, that contributes to defining the puzzling nature of this disease in pediatric patients.To our knowledge, extrapulmonary clinical presentations of 2019 novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) have rarely been reported.Generally, COVID-19 cases have fever, cough, respiratory distress findings (dyspnoea, intercostal retraction, cyanosis etc.).
title_summ: COVID‐19 cardiac involvement in a 38‐day old infantCutaneous manifestation of COVID‐19 in images: a case reportGuillain‐Barré syndrome in a patient with antibodies against SARS‐COV‐2Symmetrical polyneuropathy in Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)New type of corona virus induced acute otitis media in adultClinical findings in a patient with haemophilia A affected by COVID‐19
title_abstract_phrases: Guillain‐Barré syndrome in a patient with antibodies against SARS‐COV‐2There are now several reports on neurologic features of SARS‐CoV‐2 infection.(1 2) In a recent study of 214 patients with COVID‐19, 78 (36.4%) patients had neurological manifestations, including headache, dizziness, acute cerebrovascular diseases, and impaired consciousness.(2)Symmetrical polyneuropathy in Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)The outbreak of the novel coronavirus that began in late December 2019 was announced as a pandemic by the World Health Organization as the number of cases is increasing exponentially throughout the globe.We report the case of an infant who tested positive for severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS‐CoV‐2) and developed mild cardiovascular inflammation, a novelty for patients of very young age, that contributes to defining the puzzling nature of this disease in pediatric patients.Clinical findings in a patient with haemophilia A affected by COVID‐19At the end of 2019, a cluster of pneumonia patients were confirmed to be infected with a novel coronavirus, known as severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2), in Wuhan, Hubei Province, China.Cutaneous manifestation of COVID‐19 in images: a case reportIn December 2019, China reported the first group of pneumonia cases associated with a new coronavirus, 2019-SARS-CoV-21 .To our knowledge, extrapulmonary clinical presentations of 2019 novel coronavirus disease (COVID-19) have rarely been reported.
